page.title: 01CHALFONT ST GILES SEER GREEN
page.content: This area covers the major part of Chalfont St Giles including the old picturesque village centre and the northern part of the much smaller vill age of Seer Green.Both nestle in very pleasantly wooded rural countryside and provide an excellent haven for the London commuter.Since the coming of the railway in the 1920s Seer Green has grown from a hamlet to a village of about 2,000 inhabitants.A new hous ing estate begun in the late 1970s pro vides housing in the middle executive range and has brought many more child ren to the village.Chalfont St Giles has also grown extensively since the 1940s.Both villages were at one time rural farming communities.There is little industry and few of the inhabi tants work locally.
